text: Acestrorhynchus falcatus is a species of fish in the family Acestrorhynchidae. It was described by Marcus Elieser Bloch in 1794, originally under the genus Salmo. It inhabits the Orinoco and Amazon Rivers in the regions of Suriname, Guyana, and French Guiana. It reaches a maximum total length of , and a maximum weight of . Acestrorhynchus falcatus feeds on finfish.Food items reported for Acestrorhynchus falcatus at www.fishbase.org. It is of minor interest to commercial fisheries. ==References== Category:Acestrorhynchidae Category:Fish described in 1794
title: Acestrorhynchus falcatus
